intro: Ancistrorhynchus glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered armored catfish, is a freshwater fish native to South America. It belongs to the family Loricariidae, characterized by its scaleless body covered in bony plates. The species is distinguished by its unique, clustered arrangement of tubercles on its body. It typically inhabits slow-moving rivers and streams with muddy bottoms. Ancistrorhynchus glomeratus is often found in groups and is known for its ability to burrow into substrates.
